TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: ti sa Pułałuyałuyan tsug a marivu katua vaław.
ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan cog a marivo katoa valjaw.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan liked to quarrel with his wife.

S.FORM: nu keman ini pakani, marka vełatjen.
no keman ini pakani, marka veljatjen.
S.TRANSL: When they ate he didn’t give her food, but they hit one another(?).

S.FORM: qau limutseng azua vaław; vaik a łetaladj tua verung nua tsuqu.
qao limoceng azoa valjaw; vaik a ljetaladj toa verong noa coqo.
S.TRANSL: His wife was angry, and went into a hole in a bischoffia tree.

S.FORM: qau tsuatsuay anga malap ti sa Pułałuyałuyan tua putjaw, sa putjavi a tsuqu, a muri pałekatsauan tua vaław.
qao coacoay anga malap ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan toa potjaw, sa potjavi a coqo, a mori paljekacaoan toa valjaw.
S.TRANSL: After a time Pułałuyałuyan took an axe and chopped at the tree to get his wife out.

S.FORM: manu "teng," aya, milayap a sema tjai likuz tua łavek.
mano "teng," aya, milayap a sema tjai likoz toa ljavek.
S.TRANSL: But it (or she) said “Tung,” and she flew to the far side of the sea.

S.FORM: tsuatsuay anga mapuvarung ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
coacoay anga mapovarong ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: After a time Pułałuyałuyan got anxious.

S.FORM: qemaqivu tua sikataqałan tu vaik a qemałup.
qemaqivo toa sikataqaljan to vaik a qemaljop.
S.TRANSL: He called his fellow-villagers to go hunting.

S.FORM: qau kiłavaran ti sa Pułałuyałuyan: "tiaken makamaza ken i dungdung tua łavek.
qao kiljavaran ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan: "tiaken makamaza ken i dongdong toa ljavek.
S.TRANSL: So Pułałuyałuyan said: “I’ll go along here near the sea.

S.FORM: timun pakazua-u itjua pungayan."
timon pakazoa-o itjoa pongayan."
S.TRANSL: You go along by the cliffs.”

S.FORM: manu neka nu satsemel.
mano neka no sacemel.
S.TRANSL: There was no wild game.

S.FORM: nu paluku, qatjuvi marka ngaḍi sakamaya.
no paloko, qatjovi marka ngadri sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: If they started anything, it was just snakes and badgers.

S.FORM: qau kirivu a sikataqałan.
qao kirivo a sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: The villagers complained:

S.FORM: "aku neka nu satsemel?" aya kivadaq tjai sa Pułałuyałuyan.
"ako neka no sacemel?" aya kivadaq tjai sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: “Why is there no game?” they asked Pułałuyałuyan.

S.FORM: qau kiłavaran ti sa Pułałuyałuyan: "nuka qatjuvi, nuka ngaḍi kuangu," aya kiłavaran.
qao kiljavaran ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan: "noka qatjovi, noka ngadri koango," aya kiljavaran.
S.TRANSL: He replied: “Shoot even snakes and badgers,” he said.

S.FORM: qau timadju izua i łavek a qarawqawqaw sakamaya.
qao timadjo izoa i ljavek a qarawqawqaw sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: And he was there by the sea shouting away.

S.FORM: qau a sikataqałan: "anema kudakudain nazua tsautsau?" aya kinemnem.
qao a sikataqaljan: "anema kodakodain nazoa caocao?" aya kinemnem.
S.TRANSL: The villagers thought: “What’s this fellow up to?”

S.FORM: qau vaiken a kiqenetj.
qao vaiken a kiqenetj.
S.TRANSL: They went to have a look.

S.FORM: mintu "łaułaułavu a djarałap," ayaya semenasenay.
minto "ljaoljaoljavo a djaraljap," ayaya semenasenay.
S.TRANSL: And he was singing: “Stretch out, banyan tree!”.

S.FORM: qau tsuay anga łemaułau a djarałap a sema tjai likuz tua łavek.
qao coay anga ljemaoljao a djaraljap a sema tjai likoz toa ljavek.
S.TRANSL: After a time the tree stretched out to the far side of the sea.

S.FORM: qau azua ti sa Pułałuyałuyan semusu a vaik tua djarałap.
qao azoa ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan semoso a vaik toa djaraljap.
S.TRANSL: And Pułałuyałuyan went along the tree.

S.FORM: mintu tsaluman tua qinałivan nua tapaw nua vaław.
minto caloman toa qinaljivan noa tapaw noa valjaw.
S.TRANSL: He reached the roof of his wife’s house,

S.FORM: qau sualapen a itung, sa vułuqan a pałeteku.
qao soalapen a itong, sa voljoqan a paljeteko.
S.TRANSL: and took off his clothes and threw them down below.

S.FORM: manu djumaken nua ałak nua vaław.
mano djomaken noa aljak noa valjaw.
S.TRANSL: His wife’s child found them.

S.FORM: "aku uzaitsu a itung, kina?
"ako ozaico a itong, kina?
S.TRANSL: “Why are these clothes here, mother?

S.FORM: matu su inalangan."
mato so inalangan."
S.TRANSL: They look like ones made by you.”

S.FORM: "maka inu ti tjama tua łavek?"
"maka ino ti tjama toa ljavek?"
S.TRANSL: “How did your father get here across the sea?”

S.FORM: qau sualapen ni sa Pułałuyałuyan a dangiłan, sa vułuqan uta.
qao soalapen ni sa Poljaljoyaljoyan a dangiljan, sa voljoqan ota.
S.TRANSL: Then Pułałuyałuyan took off his apron (loincloth?) and threw that down too.

S.FORM: qau djumaken nua kakeḍian
qao djomaken noa kakedrian
S.TRANSL: The child found it.

S.FORM: "aku uzaitsu a dangiłan?
"ako ozaico a dangiljan?
S.TRANSL: “Why is this apron here?

S.FORM: matu su inalangan."
mato so inalangan."
S.TRANSL: It looks like one made by you.”

S.FORM: qau łetsasaw a kina, sa kiqenetji a pasa qinałivan.
qao ljecasaw a kina, sa kiqenetji a pasa qinaljivan.
S.TRANSL: The mother went out, and looked up at the roof.

S.FORM: mintu djemelidjeli ti sa Pułałuyałuyan i vavaw tua qinałivan.
minto djemelidjeli ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan i vavaw toa qinaljivan.
S.TRANSL: There was Pułałuyałuyan laughing on the roof.

S.FORM: qaqivuin anga nua vaław a pasa qumaqan.
qaqivoin anga noa valjaw a pasa qomaqan.
S.TRANSL: His wife called to him to come indoors.

S.FORM: qau maseleman anga, keman tua kaiven.
qao maseleman anga, keman toa kaiven.
S.TRANSL: After dark they sat down to supper.

S.FORM: manu ini kan ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
mano ini kan ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan didn’t eat.

S.FORM: qau kivadaqan nua vaław: "anema su tjenglayan a keman?" ayain.
qao kivadaqan noa valjaw: "anema so tjenglayan a keman?" ayain.
S.TRANSL: His wife asked him: “What would you like to eat?”

S.FORM: "avan a vałetjuk sakamaya a tjenglayan a keman."
"avan a valjetjok sakamaya a tjenglayan a keman."
S.TRANSL: “I would just like to eat an orange (or oranges).”

S.FORM: qau siyaya tua vałetjuk sa pakani.
qao siyaya toa valjetjok sa pakani.
S.TRANSL: So she picked an orange for him and gave it to him to eat.

S.FORM: qau muri qemereng anga.
qao mori qemereng anga.
S.TRANSL: When they were going to lie down,

S.FORM: kiłavaran ti sa Pułałuyałuyan: "qemereng aken i kulakula," aya kiłavaran tua vaław.
kiljavaran ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan: "qemereng aken i kolakola," aya kiljavaran toa valjaw.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan said: “I’ll lie at the foot end,” he said to his wife.

S.FORM: a vaław: "maya qemereng i kulakula; makulakula sun."
a valjaw: "maya qemereng i kolakola; makolakola son."
S.TRANSL: His wife said: “Don’t lie at the foot end; you’ll have trouble with the feet.”

S.FORM: "qemereng aken i łaving," aya ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
"qemereng aken i ljaving," aya ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: “I’ll lie at the edge,” said Pułałuyałuyan.

S.FORM: kiłavaran a vaław: "maya qemereng i łaviłaving; małaviłaving sun.
kiljavaran a valjaw: "maya qemereng i ljaviljaving; maljaviljaving son.
S.TRANSL: His wife said: “Don’t lie at the side; you’ll have trouble at the edge.

S.FORM: qerengu izua itjua qeluz," aya a vaław.
qerengo izoa itjoa qeloz," aya a valjaw.
S.TRANSL: Lie there by the pillar,” said his wife.

S.FORM: qau vaik a qemereng sema tjua qeluz ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
qao vaik a qemereng sema tjoa qeloz ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: So Pułałuyałuyan went to lie by the pillar.

S.FORM: ita vengin inika taqed, qaritjqitjqitj.
ita vengin inika taqed, qaritjqitjqitj.
S.TRANSL: The whole night he didn’t sleep; he was just grinding his teeth.

S.FORM: kivadaqan nua vaław ti sa Pułałuyałuyan: "makuda sun?
kivadaqan noa valjaw ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan: "makoda son?
S.TRANSL: His wife asked him: “What’s the matter with you?

S.FORM: aku ini sun a taqed?
ako ini son a taqed?
S.TRANSL: Why don’t you sleep?

S.FORM: aku qaritjqitjqitj sun?"
ako qaritjqitjqitj son?"
S.TRANSL: Why do you grind your teeth?”

S.FORM: "maitazuangata nu keman aken tua vałetjuk," aya ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
"maitazoangata no keman aken toa valjetjok," aya ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: “It’s always just like that when I eat oranges,” he said.

S.FORM: manu pentjupetjuq tua qeluz nua tapaw.
mano pentjopetjoq toa qeloz noa tapaw.
S.TRANSL: In fact he was pulling out the pillar of the house.

S.FORM: qau sa pasusu-i tua nałemauław a djarałap a tapaw.
qao sa pasoso-i toa naljemaoljaw a djaraljap a tapaw.
S.TRANSL: And he caused the whole house to follow the line of the stretched out banyan tree.

S.FORM: qau małianga patseged anga tiamadju a mapułat.
qao maljianga paceged anga tiamadjo a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: Next day they all woke up.

S.FORM: mintu i łaviłaving anga tua łavek.
minto i ljaviljaving anga toa ljavek.
S.TRANSL: And there they were on the edge of the sea.

S.FORM: qau mingtjus anga azua vaław.
qao mingtjos anga azoa valjaw.
S.TRANSL: His wife was startled.

S.FORM: "aku imazanga ken?" aya kiłavaran.
"ako imazanga ken?" aya kiljavaran.
S.TRANSL: “Why am I here now?” she said.

S.FORM: qau kiłavaran ti sa Pułałuyałuyan: "tiaken a nakematsu a pasa maza.
qao kiljavaran ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan: "tiaken a nakemaco a pasa maza.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan said: “It was I who brought you here.

S.FORM: ini anga nakuya aken.
ini anga nakoya aken.
S.TRANSL: I’m not bad any more.

S.FORM: mayanga mavilad.
mayanga mavilad.
S.TRANSL: Don’t run away.

S.FORM: a pareka nanguanguaqi anga itjen mapułat."
a pareka nangoangoaqi anga itjen mapoljat."
S.TRANSL: Let’s all be good to one another.”
